description: Red-White-Red Card (Rot-Weiß-Rot Karte) for Qualified Workers in Austria under the official immigration scheme.

meta.processing_time_standard: Approximately 8–12 weeks (including labour-market check by AMS)
meta.passport_validity: At least 3 months beyond the validity of the applied permit
meta.photo_spec: 35x45 mm, ICAO-standard passport photo, not older than 6 months
meta.min_funds_requirement: Salary threshold applies depending on category; see employer-offer and gross wage conditions as per RWR Card requirements

documents.title: Original Passport (Valid + Copies)
documents.description: Passport valid for intended stay; at least two blank pages. Provide copies of all used pages and visas.

documents.title: Employer's Declaration (Arbeitgebererklärung)
documents.description: Signed employer’s declaration required for RWR Card application.

documents.title: Points Calculator Output / Proof
documents.description: Print-out or screenshot of the official points-calculator showing you meet the threshold (e.g. ≥ 55 points for many categories).

documents.title: Apostilled Degree or Vocational Certificate
documents.description: Your degree/diploma certificate, MEA-apostilled (for Indian documents), translated to German/English if required.

documents.title: Experience Certificates / Job Letters
documents.description: Proof of relevant work experience — reference letters describing your role, durations, responsibilities.

documents.title: Police Clearance Certificate (PCC) with Apostille
documents.description: PCC from Indian authorities (not older than 3 months) and MEA-apostilled to be valid for Austrian application.

documents.title: Health / Travel Insurance (initial)
documents.description: Insurance coverage for entry period until Austrian statutory insurance can start.

steps_flow.title: Secure a Job Offer & Employer Declaration
steps_flow.description: Get a binding job offer from an Austrian employer and obtain the signed Employer’s Declaration (Arbeitgebererklärung). Ensure gross salary meets RWR Card thresholds.

steps_flow.title: Calculate & Verify Points Eligibility
steps_flow.description: Use the official Austrian RWR-Card Points Calculator to check you meet minimum required points (e.g. 55/90 for many categories). Save the result as proof.

steps_flow.title: Legalize Indian Documents (Apostille)
steps_flow.description: Get required documents (degree, PCC, etc.) apostilled via MEA/e-Sanad or authorised centre before submission to Austrian Embassy/Consulate.

steps_flow.title: Submit Application at Austrian Embassy / Consulate
steps_flow.description: Submit all documents (passport, employer letter, points proof, legalized docs, insurance) to the Austrian Embassy/Consulate; embassy will forward to AMS for labour-market check.

steps_flow.title: Await AMS Approval & Visa D Issuance
steps_flow.description: Once AMS approves (typically within 8-12 weeks), the embassy issues a Visa D allowing entry. After arrival, you collect the Red-White-Red Card (residence & work permit).

eligibility.required_education: Relevant degree/vocational qualification recognized in Austria
eligibility.required_employment_status: Binding job offer from Austrian employer + signed employer declaration
